    • Method Detail

      • javaClassName

        public java.lang.String javaClassName()
        Returns:
        the mangled Java class name for this class. This should not be called outside of this class.

      • toClass

        public final java.lang.Class<? extends Object> toClass()
        Specified by:
        toClass in class ClassRef
        Returns:
        the Java Class object for this class. For Fabric classes (i.e., ones that extend fabric.lang.Object), this is the Class object for the interface corresponding to the Fabric type, and not the _Proxy or _Impl classes.

      • toDeclaringClass

        public final java.lang.Class<? extends Object> toDeclaringClass()
        Returns the outermost class in which this class is declared. e.g., if this class represents Foo._Static, then the class Foo is returned.

      • writeImpl

        protected void writeImpl(java.io.DataOutput out)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Serialized format:
        • short length of class OID's store's name
        • byte[] class OID's store's name
        • long class OID's onum
        • byte whether this is a reference to the _Static class
        • short class hash length
        • byte[] class hash
        Specified by:
        writeImpl in class ClassRef
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
